Package com.sanyavertolet.interview.math.expressions

Class RangeExpression

java.lang.Object
com.sanyavertolet.interview.math.expressions.Expression
com.sanyavertolet.interview.math.expressions.RangeExpression
public class RangeExpression extends Expression
Represents a range of cells in a spreadsheet, defined by a start and end CellReference. The RangeExpression class is a specific type of Expression that encapsulates a rectangular area of cells.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructs a RangeExpression with the specified start and end cell references.

  • Constructor Details

    • RangeExpression

      public RangeExpression(CellReference startCell, CellReference endCell) throws RangeParsingException
      Constructs a RangeExpression with the specified start and end cell references. The start cell must be the top-left cell, and the end cell must be the bottom-right cell of the range.
      Parameters:
      startCell - the start cell reference (top-left) of the range.
      endCell - the end cell reference (bottom-right) of the range.
      Throws:
      RangeParsingException - if the start or end cell is null, if they are equal, or if the start cell is not before the end cell in both row and column.

    • isRow

      public Boolean isRow()
      Determines if the range spans a single row.
      Returns:
      true if the range is a single row; false otherwise.

    • isColumn

      public Boolean isColumn()
      Determines if the range spans a single column.
      Returns:
      true if the range is a single column; false otherwise.

      Returns the total number of cells in the range.
